courses.title: Python Programming for young advanced hackers
courses.description: A hands-on, project-based introduction to coding for beginners, kids, and teens, covering basics to object-oriented programming.

chapters.title: Getting Ready for Python Programming & Hello World
chapters.description: Introduction to programming, running Python in the browser, and writing your very first console programs with print() and comments.

chapters.title: Variables, Numbers, and Simple Math
chapters.description: Store numbers in variables, use arithmetic operators, and build basic math expressions that print results to the console.

chapters.title: Function Basics and Built-ins
chapters.description: See functions as helpers, call built-in functions like print(), len(), and round(), and read their results from the console.

chapters.title: Data Types and Type Conversion
chapters.description: Work with integers, floats, strings, and booleans, convert between them, and understand how types affect operators and printed output.

chapters.title: Execution Flow and Debugging
chapters.description: Follow how Python runs code line by line, trace variables, and use print-debugging to understand and fix program behavior.

chapters.title: Operators and Comparisons
chapters.description: Use arithmetic, comparison, assignment, and logical operators to build expressions and decision conditions that drive printed results.

chapters.title: Numbers, Math Library, and Randomness
chapters.description: Do more advanced math with the math module, exponents, rounding, and controlled randomness for simple console-based simulations.

chapters.title: Working with Text: Strings
chapters.description: Create and manipulate strings, use indexing and slicing, apply string methods, and format output using f-strings.

chapters.title: Lists, Tuples, and Dictionaries
chapters.description: Store collections of data using lists, tuples, and dictionaries, and access, update, and iterate over their items with printed feedback.

chapters.title: Sets and Basic Data Operations
chapters.description: Use sets to handle unique items, perform union and intersection, and combine sets with other collections in console-based programs.

chapters.title: Conditional Logic: If, Elif, Else
chapters.description: Make decisions in your programs using if/elif/else, nested conditions, and logical operators to control what gets printed.

chapters.title: Loops and Iteration Patterns
chapters.description: Repeat work using for and while loops, range(), and common patterns for iterating over strings and collections, with visible console output.

chapters.title: Functions, Parameters, and Return Values
chapters.description: Define your own functions with parameters and return values, use default arguments, and verify behavior by printing function calls.

chapters.title: Comprehensions, map, filter, and zip
chapters.description: Use list/dict/set comprehensions and functional tools like map(), filter(), and zip() to transform and combine collections and print the results.

chapters.title: Object-Oriented Python: Classes and Objects
chapters.description: Learn the basics of object-oriented Python: defining classes, creating objects, and using attributes and methods with console-based examples.

courses.title: SQL Data Hacking for Young Pros
courses.description: Master the language of data. A hands-on, project-based course using SQLite to query, analyze, and build databases from scratch.

chapters.title: The Data Matrix: Intro to SQLite & Tables
chapters.description: Understand what a database is, how SQLite works, and run your first query to peek inside a table.

chapters.title: Selecting Your Target: The SELECT Statement
chapters.description: The 'Hello World' of SQL. Learn to retrieve specific columns, use aliases, and fetch all data with the wild card (*).

chapters.title: Filtering the Noise: The WHERE Clause
chapters.description: Filter results to find exactly what you need using equality, inequality, and comparison operators.

chapters.title: Advanced Search Patterns: LIKE and Logical Operators
chapters.description: Combine conditions with AND/OR/NOT and use wildcard pattern matching (LIKE) to find text that 'looks like' your query.

chapters.title: Ranking and Slicing: ORDER BY and LIMIT
chapters.description: Sort your data alphabetically or numerically and limit the output to see only the top-tier results.

chapters.title: Computed Columns and Nulls
chapters.description: Perform basic math directly in your queries, handle missing data (NULL), and format your output results.

chapters.title: Data Intelligence: Aggregation Functions
chapters.description: Don't just read data, understand it. Use COUNT, MAX, MIN, SUM, and AVG to get statistics from your tables.

chapters.title: Categorizing Data: GROUP BY and HAVING
chapters.description: Group rows into buckets to summarize data by category and filter those groups using the HAVING clause.

chapters.title: Inserting New Data: The INSERT Statement
chapters.description: Stop just looking and start creating. Learn how to add single or multiple rows of new data into your tables.

chapters.title: Modifying History: UPDATE and DELETE
chapters.description: Learn the dangerous art of modifying existing records and permanently deleting data from your database.

chapters.title: Architecting the Base: CREATE TABLE and Data Types
chapters.description: Design your own schema. Create tables, define column data types (INTEGER, TEXT, REAL), and understand constraints.

chapters.title: The Relational Model: Keys and Constraints
chapters.description: Understand how tables talk to each other using Primary Keys and Foreign Keys to keep data integrity.

chapters.title: Connecting Tables: INNER and LEFT JOINS
chapters.description: The power of SQL lies in connections. Merge data from multiple tables into a single result set using JOINs.

chapters.title: Inception Queries: Subqueries
chapters.description: Write queries inside queries. Use the result of one select statement to drive the filter or logic of another.

chapters.title: Optimization and Views
chapters.description: Save complex queries as virtual tables (Views) and learn the basics of Indexes to make your searches lightning fast.
